page.title: 02LANDSCAPE: GRANTOWN-ON-SPEY
page.content:
HILLS AROUND GRANTOWN-ON-SPEY
Although Grantown-on-Spey lies sheltered in the Spey Valley, it is within easy access of the Cairngorm Mountains, among the highest in Britain.
From Grantown-on-Spey there aee many local hill walks. To the North and West of the town the moors stretch out past Dreggie to Laggan Hill and Gorton Hill. Both are about 400 metres high and give good views of the surrounding area. To the south of the town lies the Haughs of Cromdale,foothills of the Cairngorms. These hills were the site of a famous battle in 1690, an incident recorded in the popular folk song. For the more adventurous the Cairngorms lie a mere 20km away.
